		Question: who was saint paul the apostle

answer:
Sure, here is the answer:

Saint Paul the Apostle was a Christian Apostle. He was a Jew and a Roman citizen born in Tarsus, Cilicia, in 1st Century C.E. He was born Saul of Tarsus. He was a Pharisee before he converted to Christianity. After his conversion, he traveled through the early Christian Church spreading the Christian Gospel.
